dt: {bc}a government having a chief of state who is not a monarch and who in modern times is usually a president
{bc}a political unit (such as a nation) having such a form of government
{bc}a government in which supreme power resides in a body of citizens entitled to vote and is exercised by elected officers and representatives responsible to them and governing according to law
{bc}a political unit (such as a nation) having such a form of government
{bc}a usually specified {a_link|republican} government of a political unit
{bc}a body of persons freely engaged in a specified activity
{bc}a constituent political and territorial unit of the former nations of Czechoslovakia, the Soviet Union, or Yugoslavia

et: French {it}république{/it}, from Middle French {it}republique{/it}, from Latin {it}respublica{/it}, from {it}res{/it} thing, wealth + {it}publica{/it}, feminine of {it}publicus{/it} public {ma}{mat|real|}, {mat|public|}{/ma}
shortdef: a government having a chief of state who is not a monarch and who in modern times is usually a president
a political unit (such as a nation) having such a form of government
a government in which supreme power resides in a body of citizens entitled to vote and is exercised by elected officers and representatives responsible to them and governing according to law

dt: {bc}a small dependent country usually of the tropics

shortdef: a small dependent country usually of the tropics; especially : one run despotically

dt: former country 1922–91 in eastern Europe and northern Asia bordering on the Arctic and Pacific oceans and Baltic and Black seas; capital Moscow {it}area{/it} 8,649,512 square miles (22,402,236 square kilometers)

The Soviet Union, a union of constituent republics (Armenia, Azerbaijan, Belorussia, Estonia, Georgia, Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Latvia, Lithuania, Moldavia, Russia, Tajikistan, Turkmenistan, Ukraine, and Uzbekistan), existed from 1922 to 1991 and during that time was the largest country in the world in terms of land area.

shortdef: former country 1922—91 in eastern Europe and northern Asia bordering on the Arctic and Pacific oceans and Baltic and Black seas; capital Moscow area 8,649,512 square miles (22,402,236 square kilometers)
